ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] When rewriting ARCRecords, how do you access the fetchBeginTimestamp?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... meta.getDate() is the 14character string representation of fetch time; its whats in the ARC record metadata line. You ll need to parse this 14 character

svc@... wrote:

>
> Maybe meta.getDate() represents the same information as
> fetchBeginTimeStamp,
> but then I have the problem of converting the date to a long
>
meta.getDate() is the 14character string representation of fetch time; 
its whats in the ARC record metadata line.

You'll need to parse this 14 character representation.  There's  
org.archive.util.ArchiveUtils#parse14DigitDate(String) which will return 
you a java.util.Date.  You could call #getTime() on the returned Date 
instance to obtain a long.  Will that do you?

St.Ack

> I hope, anyone can help me here.
>
